content.text: ● Set up the circuit shown in Fig. 1.1
● F, G and H are crocodile clips
The distance between nail N and G is \(L\), as shown in Fig. 1.1
Adjust the position of G until \(L\) is approximately \(40 \text{cm}\)
● Close the switch
● Record \(L\) and the ammeter readings \(I_{1}\) and \(I_{2}\)
L =
Change \(L\) by adjusting the position of G between N and H. Measure and record \(L\), \(I_{1}\) and \(I_{2}\). Repeat until you have six sets of values of \(L\), \(I_{1}\) and \(I_{2}\)
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(\frac{I_2}{(I_1 - I_2)}\) in your table
Plot a graph of \(\frac{I_2}{(I_1 - I_2)}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(L\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line
gradient =
y-intercept =

In this experiment, you will investigate an electric circuit
You have been provided with a wooden strip with wire attached to nails
The apparatus has been set up as shown in Fig. 2.1
Ensure that the string passes over the pulley as shown in Fig. 2.1
Hang the mass hanger and four slotted masses from the small string loop, as shown in Fig. 2.2
Calculate \(\cos \theta\)
Without spilling any water into the larger container, completely fill the smaller container with water, as shown in Fig. 2.4
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(V\). Show your working
percentage uncertainty =   .........  %

● Measure and record \(\theta\)
\(\theta =\)

cos \(\theta =\)

where \(k\) is a constant
It is suggested that the percentage uncertainty in the values of \(k\) is \(15\%\)
Using this uncertainty, explain whether your results support the relationship in \((\mathbf{d})\)
Describe **four** sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment
For any uncertainties in measurement that you describe, you should state the quantity being measured and a reason for the uncertainty
You may not need to use all of the materials provided
In this experiment, you will investigate the displacement of water from a container
Describe **four** improvements that could be made to this experiment. You may suggest the use of other apparatus or different procedures
